intro: Capparis afzelii, commonly known as the African sour fig, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its thorny stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are typically sour and used in local cuisines. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native range.
